com.sorcix.sirc

Class IrcAdaptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sorcix.sirc.IrcAdaptor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageListener, ModeListener, ServerListener

    public abstract class IrcAdaptor
extends Object
implements ServerListener, MessageListener, ModeListener
    Implements all sIRC listeners. Extending this class allows you to listen to events by overriding its methods. This requires you to register the class as ServerListener, MessageListener and ModeListener based on which events you want to receive.
    Author:
    Sorcix

        Parameters:
        irc - The IrcConnection receiving this event.
        sender - The user who sent the action.
        target - The channel the action was sent to.

      • onCtcpReply

        public void onCtcpReply(IrcConnection irc,
               User sender,
               String command,
               String message)
        Description copied from interface: MessageListener
        Received a CTCP reply. Note that this event is only fired when receiving CTCP replies supported by sIRC. If you can't send a CTCP request, you won't get the reply.
        Specified by:
        onCtcpReply in interface MessageListener
        Parameters:
        irc - The IrcConnection receiving this event.
        sender - The user sending this CTCP reply.
        command - The CTCP command. (PONG, CLIENTINFO, ...)
        message - The CTCP message.
        See Also:
        User.sendCtcpClientInfo(), User.sendCtcpPing(), User.sendCtcpVersion()

      • onKick

        public void onKick(IrcConnection irc,
          Channel channel,
          User sender,
          User user,
          String message)
        Description copied from interface: ServerListener
        Someone (possibly us) was kicked from a channel.

        Note: This method does NOT return a shared user object. That means that it isn't possible to retrieve the user prefix (or any modes).

        Specified by:
        onKick in interface ServerListener
        Parameters:
        irc - The IrcConnection receiving this event.
        channel - The channel in which the user was kicked.
        sender - The user who kicked the user.
        user - The user who was kicked.

        Specified by:

      • onNick

        public void onNick(IrcConnection irc,
          User oldUser,
          User newUser)
        Description copied from interface: ServerListener
        Someone (possibly us) changed his nickname. Note that the oldUser can not be used to send messages, as that nickname no longer exists.

        Note: This method does NOT return a shared user object. That means that it isn't possible to retrieve the user prefix (or any modes).

        Specified by:
        onNick in interface ServerListener
        Parameters:
        irc - The IrcConnection receiving this event.
        oldUser - The old user nickname.
        newUser - The new user nickname.

      • onPart

        public void onPart(IrcConnection irc,
          Channel channel,
          User user,
          String message)
        Description copied from interface: ServerListener
        Someone (possibly us) left a channel.

        Note: This method does NOT return a shared user object. That means that it isn't possible to retrieve the user prefix (or any modes).

        Specified by:
        onPart in interface ServerListener
        Parameters:
        irc - The IrcConnection receiving this event.
        channel - The channel someone parted from.
        user - The user who parted.
        message - The part message, or null.

        Description copied from interface: ServerListener

        Specified by:

      • onTopic

        public void onTopic(IrcConnection irc,
           Channel channel,
           User sender,
           String topic)
        Description copied from interface: ServerListener
        Someone (possibly us) changed the topic of a channel, or we joined a new channel and discovered the topic. The sender will be null when we discovered the topic after joining.
        Specified by:
        onTopic in interface ServerListener
        Parameters:
        irc - The IrcConnection receiving this event.
        channel - The channel in which the topic was changed.
        sender - The user who changed the topic, or null.
        topic - The new topic.
